page.title: 21Station Master Spring Vale Station
page.content:
From at least 1891 to 1910 Richard Shepherd was the station master at Spring Vale Station.He lived with his wife and family at the Old Station House still situated at the top of Grimshaw Street. His sons Richard, Albert and William were also employed by the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway as clerks. Richard was heavily involved with St Johns church on Redearth Road Darwen and retired in 1910 and moved to his birth place Salop where he passed away in Whitechurch Chapel whilst reading the lesson. He is buried with his family in Darwen Old Cemetary. Richards father William was a racehourse trainer in Hednesford.
Contribution by: David Shepherd, Great Grandson of station master Richard Shepherd
